engine.parsing

Class TokenReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.parsing.TokenReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class TokenReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Reads and tokenizes a source.
    Author:
    Benny Bobaganoosh (thebennybox@gmail.com)

      • close

      • next

        public java.lang.String next()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the next token from this reader. A token can be a string that starts with an alphabetical character, a number in integer, decimal, or exponential format, a quoted piece of text, or a single character symbol.

        For example, this string: fooBar 13\234.18.9 123e37lol';123'sd;sa
        would produce these tokens: fooBar
        13
        /
        234.18
        .9
        123e37
        lol
        '
        ;
        123
        '
        sd
        ;
        sa

        Returns:
        The next token from this reader, or null if there are no more tokens.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the token fails to read.

      • parseAssert

        public void parseAssert(boolean condition,
               java.lang.String message)
                 throws java.text.ParseException
        Asserts that some condition is true. If it is not, throws a ParseException with a given message.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition that must be true.
        message - The error message if the condition is not true.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If the condition is not true.
